Judul: ANALYSIS OF 2012 M8.6 INDIAN OCEAN EARTHQUAKE COSEISMIC SLIP MODEL BASED ON GPS DATA
Abstrak: The CGPS (Continous Global Positing System) data of Sumatran GPS Array (SuGAr) and geospatial Agency (BIG) are processed to estimate the best fit coseismic slip model of the 2012 M8.6 Indian Ocean earthquake. In addition, I also include the published coseismic displacement of GPS data located in Andaman Islands and the GPS data in Java. For GPS data processing, I used GPS Analysis at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (GAMIT) 10.5 software and Global Kalman Filter (GLOBK) to generate position time series and estimate the coseismic offset. The processed GPS data result indicates that the earthquake cause displacement northeastward direction up to 25 cm in northern Sumatra. Results also show subsidence at the northern part while the central part of Sumatra show northwest direction displacement but I can not find whether subsidence or uplift signal associated to the earthquake due to the data quality. Based on the GPS coseismic data, I evaluate the coseismic slip model of Yue et al. (2012), Hayes (2012) and Hill et al., (2015). I compare the coseismic displacement result of their coseicmic slip model on a spherical layered earth model to coseimic displacement from GPS data. Results shows that coseismic faults model of Hill et al., (2015) fit the data better than the other models.

Kata Kunci: Coseismic displacement, GPS, faults model, spherical layered earth
